For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. 

Despite competitors in the area, Edelyn has the determination to improve the business through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, candies, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marceli Rose

texts.en:
Marceli Rose is 39 years old and has three school-age children. She aims to improve her variety store and increase her income to satisfy the family's necessities and finance the education of her children. She has been operating the business for almost two years. She plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she does not have enough capital. 

She is asking for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of canned goods, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, detergent soaps and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that someday, she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, detergent soaps and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en: Through patience and hard work, Isabelita believes that she will improve her family's living conditions and give her children a better life. She is now 49 years old has two school-age children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Isabelita buys and sells fruits and vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP to buy more squash, bananas, tomatoes, eggplants, and cabbages to sell in the community. She believes that she will improve the business and increase her income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy squash, bananas, tomatoes, eggplants, and cabbages to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is a 37-year-old married woman, with a dependent child. She works as a secretary for her Barangay (the smallest administrative unit in the Philippines). She also manages a shop and a pig-raising business.  She usually makes about 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) each month from her businesses.  

Lynette is asking for a loan to improve her pig sales and and develop her business. She is planning to use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs, which they need for growth and good nutrition. 

In the future, Lynette wants to keep selling healthy pigs, and to get enough income from it to save for her family's future welfare.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Femico

texts.en:
Femico is a 58-year-old married man with four grown children.  He is a corn farmer, and is also planning to get involved with livestock farming in order to give his family a better way of living.

Femico is having problems growing his pig farming business because he is prioritizing the corn farming.  Therefore, he wants a loan of 50,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy feed for his pigs. 

Femico wants to continue managing his business while it grows.  He is determined to succeed and improve things for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 37 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He has owned and operated a retail store for almost eight years. 

He would like a loan of 25,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, cooking oil, and biscuits. His profits are usually all spent on his daily expenses. Edwin is hoping that the loan that he has requested will be granted to help him expand his retail store, and become profitable.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, cooking oil, and biscuits

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking 40-year-old mother of two school-age children who is engaged in vegetable-vending business to contribute to the family income. Due to the hardships of living, she and her husband help each other in earning income to pay for their necessities and finance the education of their children.

Nida is requesting a loan of P10,000.00 buy additional stocks of string beans, eggplant, pechay, bitter melon, tomatoes, squash and onions to sell. She hopes to improve the business and make it more profitable through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of string beans, eggplant, pechay, bitter melon, tomatoes, squash and onions for sale.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Quirino

texts.en:
Quirino, a married father of five, lives in Amulung where, to earn a living, he patiently sells ice cream to the people in his village and nearby villages using his bicycle as transportation. He hopes to sell more ice cream and so has requested a loan for P6,000 to purchase additional stocks.

Quirino aspires to have a stable income in order to save for the family's future expenses. His photo was taken on his way to sell ice cream.

loans.use: to buy more ice cream to resell for profit.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Grupo Familiar "Nuevo Amanecer" esta conformado por cuatro integrantes que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo ya que pertenecen a la misma comunidad son peronas muy responsables llevan trabajando tres ciclos con la institucion, El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellos mismos porque nuevo amanecer para ellos significa empezar de nuevo ya que anteriormente estaban trabajando con otra microfinaciera pero les quedo mal entonces fue como decidieron animarse a trabajar con la institucion VisionFound y KIVA, Doña Noelia es una integrante del grupo ella cuenta con 33 años de edad esta casada con el señor Delfino desde hace 18 años juntos han formado una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales todos se encuentran estudiando, Doña Noelia se dedica a la elaboracion de pan de fiesta desde hace 18 años inicio su actividad porque su esposo Don Delfino taambien se dedicaba a esta actividad y al parecer quien inicio con la actividad fue el papá de Don Delfino. Esta vez ellos estan solicitando el credito para comprar materia prima para la elaboracion de pan de fiesta como, harina, huevo, leche, etc. Platican que en general los cuatro integrantes del grupo que la dificultad mas grande es cuando ellos van a vender a las ferias no les quieren dar lugar o el precio es demasiado caro, Doña Noelia comenta "Me gusta mucho realizar el pan de fiesta es una tradicion de familia y no quisieramos que se perdiera el pan de fiesta los que realizamos nosotros son de naranja, de nuez y vainilla aunque tambien hago gorditas de nata" A pesar de la difucultad que presentan Doña Noelia tiene la meta que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro que puedan terminar una carrera profesional y tambien quieren hacerle algunos arreglos a su casa. Los integrantes del grupo son Don Aurelio, Joel y Delfino quienes tambien estan solicitando el credito a la institucion para comprar materia prima para la elaboracion de pan ellos estan muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFound y KIVA por el credito otorgado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "New Dawn" (Nuevo Amanecer") is made up of four members who have known each other for a long time and are from the same community. The are very responsible people who are in their third cycle within the institution. 

They chose their group name themselves as it signifies a new start for them, they were working with a different microfinance institution previously, which was why they were encouraged to work with VisionFound and KIVA. 

Noelia, 33, is a group member and has been married to Delfino since she was 18. Together they have five children, all of whom are currently in education.

Noelia has been baking bread for a living since she was 18, as her husband Delfino is also employed in this trade. It seems that the business was originally started by Delfino's father.

They are requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making bread like flour, eggs and milk, etc. The four members claim that, in general, the greatest difficulty that they face is when they go to markets to sell their goods and find that there is no place for them or that it is too expensive. Noelia comments "I really enjoy making bread, as it is a family tradition and we do not want to lose the breads that we make. Ours are orange, walnut and vanilla, although we also make cream gorditas."

Despite the difficulties that Noelia faces, her goal is to provide her children with a better future, so that they can finish their education, and to make some repairs to their home.

The other group members are Aurelio, Joel and Delfino who are also requesting loans from the institution to buy ingredients for making bread. They are very happy and grateful to VisionFound and KIVA for the offered loan.

loans.use: to buy bread-making ingredients.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Due to the lack of job opportunities, Mirriam provides pedicure and manicure service to generate income. She is 26 years old and was separated from her husband due to family conflicts and unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she has the determination to achieve her goals. She walks around their village to render her service to her customers. Being kind and friendly to others, she wins more customers. 

In this regard, she aims to continue and strengthen her business. She is requesting an additional capital of P10,000 to buy the cosmetics and materials needed for providing this service. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy needed cosmetics and materials for pedicure and manicure

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Los Trapiches Group

texts.es:
Los Trapiches es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 personas alegres, amables y muy trabajadoras,  cada una de estas personas tiene una actividad económica Hortencia vende ropa, Claudia tiene un club de nutrición, Petra y Rocio venden calzado y Alberto ofrece servicio de albañilería. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una región cañera.

Alberto es joven soltero, que se dedica al trabajo de la albañilería desde hace un poco mas de dos años, el platica que no tuvo oportunidad de seguir estudiando así que aprendió un oficio el cual desempeñar y para ganar su dinero y poder contribuir con el gasto del su hogar en casa de sus padres.

Su trabajo consiste en la construcción de casas, bardas, techos y corredores.  El dijo "lo que mas me gusta de mi oficio es que participo en el construcción de los hogares y es algo bonito ver como una familia se va levantando y de paso gano mi dinero con el que ayudo a mi familia"

El invertirá este crédito en la compra de carretilla, tablones para seguir con su oficio. 

El espera a futuro con sus ganancias hacer algunas mejoras en su hogar y dar a sus padres una mejor vida.

Este grupo agradece a Vision Fund por el apoyo que les ha brindado a sus familia y ha sus negocios.
texts.en:
"Los Trapiches" is the name of a group made up of five kind, cheerful, and very hardworking people. Each one of them has a financial activity: Hortencia sells clothing, Claudia runs a nutrition club, Petra and Rocio sell footwear, and Alberto offers brickwork services. This group is located in a sugarcane region.

Alberto is a young single man who has been working in brickwork for a little more than two years. He says that he did not have the opportunity to continue studying, so he learned a trade. He works in this trade to earn money to be able to contribute to the expenses of his home in his parents' house. 

His job consists of the construction of homes, walls, roofs, and corridors. He said, "What I like the most about my job is that I partake in the building of homes, and it's something beautiful to see as a family gradually lifts themselves up, and in passing, I earn money which will help my family" 

He will use this loan to buy a wheelbarrow and wooden planks to continue with his trade.

In the future, he hopes to use his earnings to make improvements in his home and give his parents a better life.

This group is grateful for Vision Fund because of the support provided to their families and business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow and wooden planks.

loans.name: Dania Group

texts.es:
Doña Gabriela es otro de los integrantes del grupo Dania, Ella solo estudio la primaria, esta casada con Jose que se dedica al trabajo del campo y tiene dos hijos. Ella platica que cuando ella estudio solo había en su comunidad educación primaria y para seguir estudiando tenían que salir a otros lugares pero era mucho gasto así que desde pequeños los enseñaban a trabajar los hombres aprendían el trabajo del campo y las mujeres las labores del hogar pero ahora los tiempos han cambiado y  ella y su esposo trabajan para dar a sus hijos mas oportunidades de estudio.

Doña Gabriela desde hace un poco mas de 3 años inicio a vender maíz, tortillas y masa con el propósito de ganar su dinero y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, con el paso de los años ha hecho buenos clientes y sus ganancias han aumentado lo cual le permite dar a sus hijos una mejor vida.

ella realiza sus ventas desde su casa y como ya es conocida sus clientes acuden hacerle el gasto, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz y leña para continuar realizando su actividad.

A futuro le gustaría emprender un nuevo negocio ya sea de abarrotes o vender ropa.

Le grupo Dania agradece el apoyo que se les ha brindado a través de estos prestamos para sus negocios los cuales también les ayudan a dar a sus familias una mejor vida.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Gregoria venta de refrescos
Mirna venta de frutas y verduras
Araceli venta de artículos para el hogar 
Liliana venta de quesos
Yanet venta de tortillas
Valentina Venta de refrescos y dulces
texts.en:
Gabriela is another one of the "Dania" communal bank group members. She only studied at elementary school level. She is married to Jose, who does farm work, and she has two children. She told us that when she was studying, there was only an elementary school in her community and in order to continue studying she would have had to go to another town and it would have been expensive. Since she was young she was taught how to work hard; the boys were taught how to farm and the girls were taught how to work in the home. Now times have changed and she and her husband both work to give to their children more opportunity to study. 

A little over three years ago Gabriela started to sell corn, tortillas and tortilla dough with the idea of earning income to help her husband with the household expenses. With the passing of time she has made good customers and her profits have increased which has allowed her to give her children a better quality of life. 

She runs her business out of her home and because she is well known, her customers are happy to spend their money with her. This loan she will use to buy corn and firewood to be able to continue with her business. 

In the future she would like to open a new business, perhaps selling groceries or clothing.

The communal bank group "Dania" is thankful for the support that has been given to them through loans for their businesses, which also help them give their families a better quality of life. 

The other group members are:
Gregoria who sells drinks
Mirna who sells fruits and vegetables
Araceli who sells household items  
Liliana sells cheese
Yanet sells tortillas 
Valentina sells drinks and candies

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 36 years old, is married and they were blessed with three children. She has been a retailer of soy sauce and vinegar for almost one year. Together with her husband, she sells their commodities in different municipalities. She wants to access a loan amounting to Php 20,000 to purchase bottles to use in selling soy sauce and vinegar. Her monthly net income is Php 6,000. Her profit usually goes to their daily expenditures and to the allowances of their children going to school.

loans.use: To purchase bottles to use in selling soy sauce and vinegar

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a loving father of two, who is 51 years old and married to Amelia. Raul is a government employee of their municipality. With his passion to give his family a comfortable living, Raul manages a hog raising business, particularly hogs for breeding.

Raul admits that his income for being an employee is not enough to sustain his family and at the same time cover his hogs' feed. In this connection, Raul is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He believes that the loan will help him provide his hogs' feed.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en:
Victorino started to work with his uncle's photography business at the age of 16. Since he already had enough experience, he decided to establish his own photography business. Aside from photography, he also offers printing of T-shirts and is engaged in the livestock business. Victorino owns and has operated his hog raising business for three years and four years for his fishpond business.

Victorino desires to have continuous smooth flow of his businesses so he has been doing his very best in  his role both to family and business so his children can finish their studies and he can improve his financial stability. He and his wife both work together in order to succeed. 

Victorino plans to purchase 20 bags of livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines and due to the expensive cost of these livestock supplies, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. He hopes to get this loan amount so he can achieve his goal in life.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines for his livestock business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48, married, and has four children. They live in a village planting rice and raising livestock for sale. As responsible parents, they aim to educate all their children and give them a better life. Due to financial difficulty, Teresita engages in buying and selling fruits and vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She aim to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in the market but she has limited capital. 

In this regard, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy more stock of tomatoes, garlic, onions, ginger, potatoes, cabbages, sweet potatoes and squash to sell. She believes that the loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that she will become successful and financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, garlic, onions, ginger, potatoes, cabbages, sweet potatoes and squash to sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier en su venta de masa y de minutos  celulares  le ha ido muy bien; el recibió previamente un credikiva con el cual compró celulares, dulcería y comida, incrementando sus ventas con sus nuevos equipos y también logó hacer una nueva oferta de comidas, financiando la cartera de crédito entre los clientes. Ahora tiene más ingresos y ha mejorado su calidad de vida, pues hay nuevos beneficios para sus hijos. Él dice a sus financiadores “Muchas gracias por la ayuda, es una buena labor que ayuda a las personas mas necesitabas”. En la actualidad Javier está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará un computador, y más inventario de víveres para sus comidas y maíz para hacer masa , porque se acercan las fiestas carnavalearas y la población de compradores de alimentos, crece usualmente en esta época, haciendo que la inversión de su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en:
It has gone very well for Javier in his business selling dough and cell-phone minutes.  He received a previous Kiva loan with which he bought cell phones, sweets, and food, increasing his sales with his new equipment.  He also managed to make new food sales, financing the loan portfolio among his customers.

Now he has more income and he has improved his quality of life because there are new earnings for his children.  He says to his financial backers: "Thank you very much for the help.  It's a good job that helps the most needy people."

Currently Javier's requesting a Kiva loan to buy a computer, more supplies for his food, and corn to make dough.  The Carnival celebrations are approaching and the community of people who buy food usually grows during this period, which will make his Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy supplies, corn, and a computer

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Don Andrés es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable es la primera vez que estará trabajando con la institución platica que tiene 43 años de edad es un hombre casado desde hace años con la señora María del Carmen juntos han formado una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales tres de ellos aun son dependientes que se encuentran estudiando, Don Andrés solo estudio la secundaria y tiene una rosticería desde hace 4 años, Platica que inicio su negocio porque anteriormente era carpintero en la ciudad solo que muchas veces no hay trabajo y tenía que descansar varios periodos de tiempo, fue como decidió emprender su rosticería, solo que al inicio se le dificulto mucho ya que nadie le ofrecía apoyo para iniciar su rosticería, prácticamente don Andrés no tenía conocimiento de nada ni siquiera para preparar el pollo platica que sus pollos al principio les faltaba cocinar (Crudos),se le quemaba para poder aprender tuvieron que pasar tres meses, entre otras situaciones que tuvo que vivir quizás también influía en la maquina porque inicio con una maquina usada, esta vez Don Andrés está solicitando el crédito para comprar otra máquina porque piensa abrir otra rosticería en otro municipio,  platica de las dificultades por las cuales ha presentado que fue fueron sus dos accidentes el primero fue debido a la carga de trabajo como consecuencia se quedo dormido en el volante porque se encontraba conduciendo de noche  las consecuencias no afectaron mucho al negocio, tampoco a su familia sin embargo si hubo consecuencias en su salud y gasto mucho en medicamentos, en este accidente perdió la camioneta que apenas había comprado y tuvo que recurrir  a una camioneta mas viejita con la que inicio claro que a esta le cabían menos pollos Don Andrés acostumbra traer el pollo en otro municipio que queda como una hora de camino. En su otro accidente su hubo grandes pérdidas porque en este si tuvo que cerrar una pollería que tenía en otro municipio, en este último accidente aunque no tuvo la culpa tuvo que pagar todo lo ocasionado las pérdidas materiales del otro carro. Sin embargo a pesar de todo esto Don Andrés tiene la meta de que sus hijos tengan que un patrimonio que les permita vivir planamente, pero también le gustaría que sus negocios le den lo suficiente para pode asegurar su vejez no le gustaría vivir con preocupaciones económicas.
texts.en:
Andrés is a very hardworking and responsible man and this is the first time that he will be working with the institution. He tells us that he is 43 and has been married to María del Carmen for several years, together they have 5 children and 3 of them are dependent on them and still in education.

Andrés only obtained a secondary school education and has had a rotisserie for four years. He says he started his business because he used to be a carpenter and often found himself without work for periods of time. He decided to start his business, which was difficult to begin with as no-one offered him any support. Andrés had practically no knowledge of how to run his business, not even how to prepare the chickens. He tells us that in the beginning his chickens were raw and needed cooking, he often burned them and it took three months for him to learn. Along with the some of other experiences he has had, this may have been partly caused by the machine, as he began his business with a second-hand machine. 

Andrés is requesting the loan to buy another machine as he is thinking about opening another rotisserie in another town. He tells us that the difficulties he has faced include his two accidents, the first of which happened because of his workload as he fell asleep at the wheel whilst driving at night, although the consequences have not affected his business nor his family, although his health has been affected and he has to spend a lot on medicines. In the accident he lost the van that he had only just bought and had to go back to an older van, which obviously could not hold as many chickens.

Andrés is used to taking the chicken to another town and spends around an hour en route. In his other accident, he experienced greater losses as he had to close a chicken shop in another town. Although this accident was not his fault, he was forced to pay for the lost materials from the other vehicle.

However, despite all of this, Andrés has a goal for his children to have a legacy so that they can live fully, but he would also like his businesses to do well enough to provide for him in his old age as he would not like to live with financial concerns.

loans.use: to buy machinery for a new rotisserie.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 38 years old and has two school-age children. She buys and sells vegetables in the market to earn her income. She aims to improve and strengthen her business to increase her income so she can support the education of her children and satisfy their needs. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of 6,000 PHP to buy taro, tomatoes, beans, potatoes, onions, and garlic for sale. Through her patience and sacrifices, she believes that she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food for sale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 29 years old, married, and has one infant child. Her husband is a farmer, and they live happily in a rural community. Due to hardships, they aim to upgrade their poor living conditions to give their child a better life. 

Marisa is a cook who sells snack foods in the community to help her husband generate income. She plans to cook different kinds of snack foods to sell, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional 8,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar, oils, coconut, and rice cakes to cook and sell in the community. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from Amulung. She is married and has two children. Her spouse is a hog dealer, and she sells snack foods like boiled eggs, fish balls, and squid balls. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month and uses it for her family's daily expenses. She is asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to increase her sales. She will buy fish, eggs, and squid to cook and sell. 

She hopes to continue providing good customer service so she can earn enough income to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish, eggs, and squid to cook and sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 7 a 12 años, en Ciudad Bicentenario, macroproyecto donde la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, apoya la construcción de comunidades sostenibles y allí  Candelaria el Gobierno Colombiano,  le otorgó su vivienda por la condición de desplazamiento en la cual vivía. Ella antes estaba pasando muchas necesidades antes de obtener su vivienda, por eso cuando salió beneficiaria, no dudó en vender todo lo que tenia en enseres y con muy poco dinero emprendió una pequeña venta de artículos de la canasta familiar, la que poco a poco ha convertido en su tienda generadora de ingresos, con la que hoy apoya  el bienestar de su familia. Su meta es lograr ofrecer a sus hijos una educación de calidad, para que tengan un mejor futuro, por eso se esmera trabajando persistentemente para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento en  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y este es un credikiva, con el cual comprará víveres, para surtir su negocio y ampliar su capital. Su   credikiva proyecta ser exitosos, porque ampliará su capacidad de comprar en mayor volumen, obtener descuentos especiales y vender mucho más que lo que usualmente vende con su propio capital.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives with her partner and their three children who are between the ages of 7 and 12 years old in the city of Bicentenario. They live in a housing development that is supported by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which supports the construction of sustainable communities. Candelaria was given a place to live in this community by the Colombian government because she was displaced from the home she was living in. Before she was given her home she had many needs, so when she became a beneficiary of this project, she didn't hesitate to sell all of her household furnishings and with the profits opened a small store with basic food necessities for a family. Little by little her small store has turned into an income generator, which she is now able to support her family with. Her goal is to be able to provide her children with a good education so that they will have a better future. This is why she works persistently to achieve her goal.     

She is currently applying for her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which is a Kiva loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries for her business and increase her capital. Her kiva loan project will be successful because it will increase her ability to buy in large quantities, and by doing so obtain special discounts and sell much more than the is usually able to sell when working only with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy groceries to restock her store.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is 24 years old, single, and earns his income providing motorcycle transport services in the village. He would like to increase his earnings and continue to provide safe travel to his passengers. Rafael is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy gasoline and maintain his motorcycle. He hopes to pay back his loan in full.

He aims to become a successful man and continue offering excellent transportation services.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 35-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children between five and 16 years old. She operates a retail store selling commodities like sugar, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, and soaps. She has been in the retail business for two years. 

Eufemia requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, chips, cookies, and biscuits to cater to the needs of her customers. In the future, Eufemia would like to expand her business to improve her family's standard of living and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, cookies, and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea is a 32-year-old man. He is married with four children. He breeds goats and sells them for meat purposes to local butchers directly from his home. He also sells at the market. He has two years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to do this.

Other sources of income include selling fruits and vegetables, which is what his wife does as she has a small vegetable stall. Together they contribute to the welfare of their family.

With this loan, he will buy eight goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy eight goats to sell.

loans.name: Joevie

texts.en:
Joevie is a 44-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three young children. He owns and operates a retail store business. He sells basic commodities like beverages, canned goods, soaps and toiletries. He earns 10,000 PHP a month by doing the retail business. 

Joevie requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks and chips so he can purchase in bulk to avoid shortage of stocks. In the future, Joevie would like to expand his business to support his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and chips.

loans.name: Ledis Maria

texts.es: Ledis vive en Arjona, municipio ubicado en el Departamento de Bolívar,  que obedece a un grupo triétnico que se dio en Colombia, con características fenotípicas trigueñas en el casco urbano y comunidades de descendencia afrocolombiana; allí se dedica  a la venta de víveres y abarrotes en una tienda, donde sus clientes compran los productos de la canasta familiar diariamente, en pequeñas cantidades y es un punto de encuentro social entre vecinos, especialmente entre amas de casa. Su negocio abre las puertas desde las 6 de la mañana, hasta las 9 de la noche para vender de contado, mientras sus compras las realizan diariamente en los abastos del municipio, con los cuales sostiene muy buenas relaciones comerciales y obtiene precios competitivos. Cuando inició su emprendimiento, lo hizo teniendo en cuenta, que sus vecinas debían caminar hasta muy lejos para comprar estos productos, por eso organizó un punto de ventas y lo abasteció poco a poco y  este ha ido creciendo. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  arroz, aceite, azúcar, café, tubérculos, refrescos etc. Con su nueva inversión tendrá mas mercancías que vender y esto atrae a su clientela porque encuentran todo lo que necesitan y se ve surtido su estantería. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva, con el cual planea cumplir su meta de crecimiento gradual, para finalmente lograr su mayor anhelo: “ el de educar con calidad a su hija”.
texts.en:
Ledis lives in Arjona, a town located in Bolivar, which is part of a triethnic group in Colombia with darker skin common in the town centres and communities descended from Afro-Columbian communities. 

She sells groceries in a shop where her customers buy basic household goods in small quantities. Her shop is a place of social gathering for local neighbours, particularly housewives. Her business opens its doors from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening for cash sales. She buys her stock daily from the town wholesalers, with whom she maintains a good business relationship and gets competitive prices. When she began her business she took into account the fact that her neighbours had to travel long distances to buy these products, so she set up a sales point, stocked it little by little and it has continued growing. 

She is currently applying for a KIVA loan, which is her first cycle with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy rice, oil, sugar, coffee, tubers and drinks etc. With this new investment she will have more merchandise to sell and this will attract customers as they will be able to find everything that they need and her shelves will be filled. This is the reason for the success of her KIVA loan, with which she plans to fulfil her goal of slowly growing her business to eventually reach her main aim of providing her daughter with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, coffee, tubers and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flower, sugar, oil, fats and other products with which he will make delicious baked goods.

loans.name: Darling Dinora

texts.es:
Darling Dinora de  26 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de 6,1 años de edad. Es originaria de  Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con sus hijos, y tener tiempo de calidad con ellos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar laboratorio clínico.
Gracias a su espiritud de  emprendimiento y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica un cafetín, desde hace 8 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad, y lo tiene ubicado en uno de los hospitales infantiles  de la región. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio comprando productos comestibles como: pan, café, azúcar, frescos naturales, gaseosas, repostería, jugos, fósforos, galletas. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Darling Dinora agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Darling Dinora is 26 years old. She's married and has two underage children aged 6 and 1. She comes from Managua, which is located in the central area of that region. In her free time, she enjoys playing with her children and spending quality time with them. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources she wasn't able to go to college, but she would have liked to have studied to become a clinical lab technician.
Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her drive to get ahead, she owns a business which is a grocery store. She has been in this line of work for the past 8 years and the store is located in one of the local children's hospitals. She greatly enjoys running this business, since it has been a means of livelihood for her and her children. The purpose of the loan is to get working capital and stock up her business by purchasing foodstuffs such as bread, coffee, sugar, fresh fruit juices, soft drinks, pastries, juices, matches, and cookies. That way she'll increase her profits in a not-so-distant future. Darling Dinora gives thanks for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent line of work.

loans.use: to get working capital and stock up her grocery store with merchandise such as bread, coffee, sugar, fresh fruit juices, soft drinks, pastries, juices, matches, and cookies.

loans.name: Haltar

texts.en:
Mrs Haltar is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her two sons in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her two sons, Tuvshinsaihan and Baasandorj, both are university students. The borrower has been running a veterinary hospital for local herders and she has been working as veterinary since 1987 in the town. She also runs a small clothing retail shop from a rental counter in the local market. 

She is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase vaccines and injections to prepare for the spring vaccination season. She is hardworking, well-organized and a strong woman.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and injections to prepare for the spring vaccination season.

loans.name: Temor

texts.en:
Temor is 52 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Temor has a business buying and selling native bags in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more native bags to sell.

Temor has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more native bags to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of seven children and has been running a grocery stall for ten years. She obtained the start up capital from her husband. 

Rose learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high transportation costs and inflation. Rose is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy groceries such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and kale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Haltar

texts.en:
Mrs. Haltar is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Batbayar runs a taxi service in town. Her older son, Nyamjantsan, 20, is a university student, and her youngest son, Enhbayar, 15, attends a local secondary school. Her middle son, Nyambat, 17, stays home and requires constant care. 

Mrs. Haltar has been staying home taking care of her son for years, and now she is planning to start her own business at home. She is requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase inventory to start a home tailoring business. Mrs. Haltar is a hardworking, caring, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a home tailoring business.

loans.name: Georgre

texts.en:
Georgre is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of five; he runs a farming business. He has been in business for the last thirteen years, and his monthly income from the business is 21,000 KES.
 
He has borrowed a fourth loan of 40,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase farm supplies. He plans to use the additional income to invest back into the business and save for future use.

Georgre's dream and hope is to be financially stable and be able to give the best education possible to his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of eight children and runs a fuel wood business. It has been in operation for six years.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to join the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is high transport costs and inflation. 

Sada is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy fuel wood and charcoal to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fuel wood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and supports four people. Maria has run a small-scale dairy farming business for the last seven years with a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is borrowing KES 10,000 with which she intends to purchase animal feeds as well as some farm input i.e fertilizers for this years’ planting season. She plans to use the additional income to re-invest back into the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her grand children.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Las Flores es  un grupo integrado por 6 personas cada una de ellas realiza una actividad económica con el propósito de día a día brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida: Angela vende calzado, Maria de los Angeles vende refrescos, Maria Luisa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, Karla venta de calzado, Margarita venta de refrescos e Irma a la venta de abarrotes. 

Doña Margarita es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, ella tiene dos hijos, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Roberto. Ella platica que siempre había querido tener una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar  y hace 5 meses con el apoyo de su esposo puso su tiendita en la cual vende variedad de abarrotes dulces y refrescos. Doña Margarita abre su negocio todos los días desde muy temprano para que sus vecinos acudan a comprar, lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que sus hijos están aprendiendo a trabajar ya que de ves en cuando la ayudan a despachar. 

Un crédito de Vision Fund le dará la oportunidad de resurtir su negocio comprando, frijol, aceite, arroz, sopa, azúcar, papel higiénico, aluminio, pasta dental, shampoo, galletas y refrescos. Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continué creciendo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y en un futuro dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiando. 

Nota: la señora del fondo de blusa y pantalón negro no es miembro del grupo pero quiso salir en la foto.
texts.en:
Las Flores is a group made up of 6 people, each of whom has a economic trade with the aim of offering their family a better life on a day to day basis. Angela sells shows, Maria de los Angeles sells drinks, Maria Luisa sells cosmetics, Karla sells shoes, Margarita sells drinks and Irma sells groceries.

Margarita is a happy and enterprising woman who has two children, she only studied a primary school education and is married to Roberto. She tells us that she always wanted to have a grocery shop in her home to be able to help with the household expenses. Five months ago, with the help of her husband, she was able to set up a little shop where she sells various groceries, sweets and drinks. Margarita opens her business early every day to welcome her neighbours. Her favourite thing about her business is that her children are learning to work as they occasionally help in the store.

A loan from Vision Fund will help her to restock her business by buying beans, oil, rice, soup, sugar, toilet paper, tin foil, tooth paste, shampoo, biscuits and drinks. She hopes that with this investment her business can continue growing and offering a better service to her customers and in the future she will be able to give her children the opportunity to continue with their studies.

NB. the woman in the background wearing the blouse and black trousers is not a group member, but she wanted to be in the photo.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, rice, soup, sugar, toilet paper, tin foil, toothpaste, shampoo, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 58-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven grown children. She has been running a sari-sari store, or variety store, for 12 years now. She sells a variety of foods, snacks, and drinks and earns 4,000 PHP per month. 

Nida is requesting a loan to buy items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, and snack foods. Through this loan, she will be able to increase her stock.

In the future, Nida hopes to expand her business and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy  items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, food snacks

loans.name: Boli

texts.en:
Mrs. Boli is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger in Dornogobi province of Mongolia. Her husband Tumenjargal, aged 57 runs a taxi service in town. Her older children have got married and live separately. Her daughters Oyundelger, aged 20 and Odontuya, aged 18 both are university students. 

The borrower has been running an organic vegetable growing and sales business for years and she is well experienced in the field. She also give suggestions and mentors newly started businesses. She is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase seeds and soils to prepare for the plantation period in spring. She is a hardworking, helpful and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soils to prepare for plantation period in spring.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a 28-year-old mother of one child, a married business lady who runs a fuel wood business. It has been in operation for one and a half years.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to join the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is high transport costs. 

Khadija is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy fuel wood and charcoal to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fuel wood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tserensevjid

texts.en:
Mr. Tserensevjid is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Tserenlham, aged 25, is a university student. His daughter Enhjin, aged 2, goes to the local kindergarten. The borrower's parents have been running a cobbler business for years and the borrower used to help them to run their business. 

Since he got married to his wife, he lives separately from his parents. So he is now planning to start his own business, providing cobbler services at home. He is now requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and tools for his newly started business. He is well-experienced, hardworking and an enthusiastic young man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and tools for his newly started business.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 53 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cleofe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Cleofe has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cleofe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es: Dora  de 52 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, histórica y hermosa ciudad en la Región Caribe Colombiana. Allí conformó su hogar y habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 18 a 22 años. Ella ofrece en un punto de atención, el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen personal; es su sala de bellezas realiza cortes de cabello, tratamientos capilares, peinados, a damas, caballeros y a jóvenes principalmente;  así mismo vende mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos, con la cual promociona perfumes, cremas, artículos de aseo, tintes, etc, mediante asesoría que da a su clientela, para potencializar su compra. Su día laboral inicia desde las 6 de la mañana y terminas solo hasta las 9 de la noche,   de lunes a domingos, y todo este esfuerzo es motivado por el mejoramiento del bienestar de su familia y el suyo propio. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos capilares, insumos de peluquería, cremas y colonias. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, a una clientela, que ella misma ha construido desde que inició su negocio hace 10 años. En la actualidad su principal meta es apoyar a sus hijos, para que logren completar sus estudios universitarios y mas adelante tener un local propio y estos son sus principales desafíos de vida.
texts.en:
Dora, 52, lives in the city of Cartagena, a historic and beautiful city in the Caribe region of Columbia. She set up her home there and lives with her partner and their two children, aged 18 and 22. She runs a beauty salon, which primarily offers haircuts and treatments to ladies, gentlemen and young people. She also sells products from specialist magazines and promotes perfumes, lotions, toiletries, dyes etc. which she recommends to her customers to complement their purchase.

Her working day starts at 6 in the morning and ends at 9 in the evening, Monday to Sunday. All her effort is motivated by a desire to improve the well being of herself and her family.

She is applying for this loan, the first loan that she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy hair products, hair dressing supplies, creams and lotions. Her sales are made on a credit and cash basis to a customer base that she has built up since she started her business 10 years ago. Her current goal is to support her children so that they can study at university and in the future she would like to have her own store, these are her main challenges in life.

loans.use: to buy hair products, hairdressing supplies, creams and lotions.

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es: Luis compró muchos insumos con los que surtió su peluquería ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, un secador profesional y una plancha. Ahora tiene mas clientes, pues con  secador nuevo y plancha ofrece a su clientela un trabajo con mayor calidad y en condiciones satisfactorias para él, porque antes atendia solo a hombres y la clientela de mujers es muy buena y obtiene mas ingresos. El dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: "Gracias, por aportar un granito de arena para que mis metas se esten cumpliendo, para algun dia tener una peluquería gigante. " En la actualidad se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar nuevamente a un credikiva, porque quiewre seguir creciendo de su mano. Con este finaciamiento comprará maquinas nuevas para motilar y para la afeitada, reemplazando así, las ya obsoletas que estaba usando y con ello impactar una vez mas a su clientela y hacerla muy fiel.
texts.en: Luis bought many supplies such as a professional hairdryer and a flattening iron with which he stocked up his hair salon located in the town of Cartagena de India. He currently has more customers, because with the new hairdryer and flattening iron he offers his clientele a higher quality work. These conditions are satisfactory for him because he used to serve only male customers, and the female clientele is very good and results in better profits. He tells his Kiva lenders: "Thank you for contributing a grain of sand towards the accomplishment of my goals, so that someday I may own a huge salon". He has recently approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to apply for a new Kiva loan, because he wishes to keep on growing through his own efforts. With this loan he'll purchase new machines for trimming and shaving hair in order to replace the old ones that he's been using. That way he'll once again make an impact on his customers and keep them very loyal.

loans.use: to purchase new machines for trimming and shaving hair.

loans.name: Edgar Manuel

texts.es: Edgar de 39 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 1 y 12 años, en Galapa, lugar conocido como un municipio artesano creador de canastos y mascaras , además de tener una gran poblacion ganadera, y en la actualidad se están llevando a cabo,  la construcción de zonas industriales a gran escala y se realiza uno de los mejores carnavales municipales, que en esta temporada  potencializa el negocio de Edgar, quien vende de comidas rápidas en un punto estratégico, en el cual desde hace 3 años ha logrado mantener buenos precios y un stock con el que inicia cada día su oferta. Antes de iniciar su negocio era administrador de un negocio igual en la ciudad de Barranquilla, poco a poco reunió dinero y tuvo la oportunidad de aprovechar su experiencia y emprender su propio generador de ingresos, hoy en el municipio de Galapa lo conocen por los deliciosos perros calientes, hamburguesas, pizza y salchipapas que elabora con las mejores salsas que él mismo prepara. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual aumentara el volumen de sus compras en insumos como panes, salsa de tomate, mayonesa, mostaza   obteniendo mejores descuentos en una época donde las ventas se incrementan para dar respuesta a los carnavales y esto es lo que hace que esta inversión sea oportuna y tenga mucho éxito. Su meta más adelante  es comprar un local y adquirir un nuevo puesto de trabajo,  que genere nuevos ingresos y mayor posicionamiento en la plaza.
texts.en:
39-year-old Edgar lives with his wife and his two children, who are 1 and 12 years old, in Galapa; a place known as a creative town for craftsmen of baskets and masks, in addition to having a large rancher population.  Currently, they are carrying out large scale construction in the industrial areas and it is the location for one of the greatest town fairs, which at the moment encourages Edgar who sells fast food at a strategic spot where for three years he has managed to maintain good prices and stock with which he makes his offering each day.  Before starting his own business he was an administrator in a similar business in the city of Barranquilla.  Little by little he raised money and had the opportunity to take advantage of his experience and begin his own generator of income.  Today, he is known in the town of Galapa for delicious hotdogs, hamburgers, pizza, and salchipapas (a kind of kebab) that he makes with the best sauces, which he prepares himself.  

Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will increase the size of his purchases of supplies like bread, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, and mustard, getting him better discounts at a time when sales increase in response to the carnivals.  This is what makes sure the investment will be opportune and very successful.  His larger goal is to buy a restaurant space and acquire a new position that will generate new income and greater reputation in the plaza.

loans.use: to buy supplies like bread, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, and mustard.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce  sells cement at Ankyeryim near Takoradi which she has done for 20 years. She is married with seven dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Joyce will use her loan to purchase more bags of cement to sell. With the new profit she will expand her cement business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of cement to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is an active person who enjoys the retail trade. For several years, she has been selling firewood, a business she still does to date. This business and the previous loan have provided her with reasonable results. Luvuno wants to expand this business but she does not have enough working capital to do this. It is for this business that she is asking for this loan to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Luvuno strives to provide for the welfare of her family and to maintain the inventory of her business. She is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her through this loan.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 50 years old and married with four children. Merlyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional carabao.

Merlyn has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional carabao.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 36-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a 17-year-old daughter, she is engaged in a retail store business. She sells soft drinks, coconut wine and basic commodities like sugar, coffee and seasonings. She has been in the retail business for two years. 

Rosita requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional commodities to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries. In the future, Rosita would like to invest in other ventures to support her family as well as to send her daughter to college.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in small house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Orhontsetseg, aged 34, helps her husband to run his business: a butcher shop. His daughters Badamlyanhua, aged 13, Angirmaa, aged 11 and Monhsuvd, aged 6 go to local schools. 

The borrower has been running his butcher shop business since 2009. He purchases meat from herders in the countryside and sells to local customers from his rental counter at the local market. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle to reduce his transportation cost in order to increase his profit. He and his wife both are hardworking, responsible and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle to reduce his transportation costs in order to increase his profits.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 63-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five grown children. She engages in a business buying and selling shells and empty bottles. She buys and at the same time sells empty bottles. She has been in this business for 17 years now. She usually earns 3,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income. 

Antonia is requesting a loan to buy shells, empty bottles and aluminum. Through this loan, she will be able to buy and sell. In the future, Antonia hopes to expand her business. She wants to build her own junk shop.

loans.use: to buy shells, empty bottles and aluminum.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 30 years old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Connie has a business selling native bags in the Philippines. Connie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more native bags to sell to her customers.

Connie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Connie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more native bags to sell.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenetsogt is 43 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Ganshur, aged 40, runs a small clothing retail business from a rental counter in the local market. His son Monhbayar, aged 11, goes to a local school. 

The borrower started his organic fruit retail business from a rental counter of a local food market in September 2012. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase large amount of organic fruits to sell to local customers during winter and spring. He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic fruits to sell to local customers during winter and spring.

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es: El grupo Jazmin esta conformado por quince integrantes todas son mujeres muy responsables pero ante todo mujeres muy trabajadoras es un grupo muy armonioso saben resolver dificultades facilmente entre ellas mantienen una amistad que las identifica de otros grupos, El nombre del grupo lo elijieron ellas mismas porque les gusto no sabe si influyo porque una de las integrantes tiene este nombre o por otra razon, Maura quin forma parte del grupo platica que tiene 38 años de edad es mama soltera de tres niños que se encuentran estuidiando, La señora Maura se dedica a la venta lenceria esta vez esta solicitando un credito para comprar sus prendas como brasier, pantaletas, mayones, entre otras cosas en la actividad lleva ya cinco años platica que inicio su actividad porque anteriormente le ayudaba a una amiga a vender pero vio que era un buen negocio por lo que decidio iniciar ella independientemente, cuenta que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas siempre trata lo mejor posible a su clientas, platica que lo mas chistoso de su trabajo es venderle ropa intima a los cabaleros ya que ellos es mas dificil de tenerlos contentos porque a unos no les gusta la tela, los colores, los estilos, tipos y a otros pues si es muy dificil convencer a los caballeros que le compren por eso casi no venden ropa intima para caballero, Maura comento "Me gusta mucho mi actividad porque gracias a la venta de ropa intima he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos que se encuentran estudiando ya que para mi ellos son mi pilares para seguir adelante, aunque luego hay clientes que se tardan en pagar pero siempre pagan tarde pero seguro" Doña Maura anteriormente solo vendia por catalogo pero penso que obtendria mas gannacias si pudiera vender varios tipos de ropa y atraer mas clientas situacion que le ha favorecido muy bien todas las tardes Doña Maura recorre las calles de su comunidad y de otras comunidades para ofrecer sus prendas, una de las metas de Doña Maura es que sus hijos puedan realizarse profesionalmente para que ellos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las otras integrantes son Florentina quien comprara maiz para tortillas, Margarita quien invertira en su taller de costura, Maribel, Beatriz y Mirna invertiran en ropa para su venta,  Doña Alicia invertira en su casa para materiales, Lizbeth C., Jazmin, Laura y Antonia invertiran en pollos y guajolotes para cria y su venta, Doña Elena, Lizberth S. y Rosalía invertiran en sus borregos para cria y venta y finalmente Leticia comprara tela para la elaboracion de cortinas para su venta. Todas ellas estan muy agradecidas con Vision Found y KIVA por el credito otorgado ya que sera de gran apoyo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Jazmin group is made up of 15 members who are all responsible and, above all, hard-working women. It is a very friendly group that knows how to solve problems easily between themselves. They have a strong friendship which makes them different from other groups. They chose the name for the group themselves because they liked it; they’re not sure if the fact that one of the members is called Jazmin influenced them or if it was something else. 

Maura is a member of the group and is 38 years old. She is the single mother of three children who are all in school. Maura sells underwear and is requesting a loan so that she can buy items such as bras, panties, tights, among other items. She has been running her business for five years and started the business  because she was helping a  friend with her underwear business and saw that it made money. That’s why she decided to set up a business of her own. She has made good sales and she always tries to treat her customers well. She says that the funniest thing about her job is selling underwear to men because they are very difficult to please. They either don’t like the material, the color, or the styles, and it’s very difficult to convince them to buy things, and that’s why she hardly ever sells to men. Maura says, "I like my job a lot because thanks to selling underwear, I have been able to provide for my children who are in school and for me they are my motivation to keep going. Some customers take a while to pay me but they always pay in the end." Maura used to sell by catalog but realized that she could make more money selling a variety of clothing to attract more customers, which has worked well for her. 

Every afternoon Maura passes through the streets of her community and other communities selling clothing. One of Maura’s goals is for her children to be able to achieve their professional dreams so that they have a better quality of life. The other members of the group are Florentina, who will buy corn to make tortillas, Margarita who will invest in her dressmaking workshop, Maribel, Beatriz,  and Miran will invest in clothes to sell, Alicia will buy materials to improve her house, Lizbeth C, Jazmin, Laura and Antonia will buy chickens and turkeys to raise and sell, Elena, Lizbeth S. and Rosalia will invest in sheep to raise and sell, finally Leticia will buy fabric to make curtains to sell.
They are all very grateful to Vision Found and Kiva for the loan which will be a great help for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzuki lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single business lady and has a grocery stall, a business which has been running for two years. She obtained the start-up capital from a neighbor. 

Nzuki learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is bad debts. 

Nzuki is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy grocery stock, e.g., tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale etc.

loans.name: Laurencio

texts.en:
Laurencio is a 34-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. He has been engaged in the fishing business for six years now. His monthly income is 4000 PHP. This is the source of his income. 

Laurencio is requesting a loan to buy fish net, fish hooks, and floaters. These materials are used in fishing. Using the loan, he will be able to catch many fish to sell in his community.

In the future, Laurencio hopes to expand his business. He also wants his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fish net, fish hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Ratinoi

texts.en:
Ratinoi is 28 years old. She is married to Parken, a businessman,and they have three children aged between eight and two years. She is a farmer, farming her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last five years.

She learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET Ltd. This will be her second loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. She has now joined a group of other farmers who are undertaking a group project of fattening livestock.

Her dream is do large-scale farming and have her own farm machinery.  She is a painstaking lady who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtsetseg is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband Altansuh, aged 32, works at a local fire department. Her children Monhbileg, aged 8 goes to a local primary school and Monhmandah, aged 3 goes to a local kindergarten. 

The borrower has been working as a saleswoman for years in the local market. She has gained a lot of experience and now she is starting her own business of clothing sales based on her experience and network. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory from Erlian, China for her newly started business. She is a hardworking, diligent and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory from Erlian, China for her newly started business.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like eggs, sugar, beverages, seasonings and soaps. She has been in the sari-sari business for two years. Her husband is a farmer.

Due to a lack of capital, Monalisa requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like eggs, sugar, noodles and biscuits. In the future, Monalisa would like to expand her business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like eggs, sugar, noodles and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a barber chair and a hair trimming machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Makadara A Group

texts.en:
Lydiah’s group has 11 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Lydiah is pictured on the right of Makadara A Group with her hand raised. Lydiah is shown with the 4 men and 7 women of her group. Her loan amount will enable her to plant half an acre with sorghum and maize. Lydiah first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lydiah joined One Acre Fund to get access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and also to improve her farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Before joining One Acre Fund, Lydiah could only harvest 1.5 bags of maize per half acre, but now she is able to harvest 3.5 bags! She plans to use future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs (such as seed and fertilizer) on credit. Lydiah’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit in total.

Please note: Catherine, a member of Samoya Bidii Group, is also pictured above. However, her husband has already appeared on Kiva and she shares her OAF membership with him. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, she is pictured as a member of the group, but will not be receiving funding from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mejorar el negocio, comprando variedad de ropa, blusas, faldas, lociones en variedad de fragancias, esto ayudara a que Ana continúe trabajando y con el negocio este en mejores condiciones.

Con el préstamo anterior ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo, que le permitió trabajar y proveer a su familia lo necesario, su negocio conto con mercadería, sus condiciones en la familia han sido estables.
texts.en:
Ana is applying for a loan because she needs to improve her business. She will buy a variety of clothing, such as shirts and skirts, as well as lotions in a variety of fragrances. This will help her to continue working, as her business will be in a better condition.

Her previous loan has proven to have a positive effect. It allowed her to work and provide necessities for her family. Her business is stocked with merchandise and her family is in a stable condition.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, such as shirts and skirts, as well as lotions.

loans.name: Briseyda Alexandra

texts.es:
Briseyda, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene un niño de 6 años de edad, vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana para ayudar a su familia con los gastos, aprendió este trabajo con su madre, tiene un año de vender aparte, trabajando de lunes a sábado.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, pantalones, calcetines, shorts, entre otra variedad, esto le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, aumentar las posibilidades de ingresos.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, sus condiciones económicas en la familia, a través del trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
28-year old Briseyda lives with her husband who has a 6-year old son. He lives with his mother. Briseyda sells American clothing to help pay for household expenses. She learned this work from her mother and has worked on her own for the past year. She works from Monday to Saturday.

Briseyda is seeking a loan to buy blouses, pants, socks, shorts and other items. The loan will help strengthen her business and increase earnings. Her goal is to improve her business and the economic status of her family through her work.

loans.use: buy blouses, pants, socks, and shorts

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Mr. Banzragch is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a 'ger' in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Oyundelger is 30 years old and stays home taking care of their daughter Bayarmaa, age 3. 

The borrower has been working with his brother-in-law since 2006. He and his brother-in-law purchase animal pelts and other primary materials from herders in the countryside. He is now requesting 2,085,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce their transportation costs when purchasing animal pelts from herders. Mr. Banzragch is hardworking, well-behaved and an honest man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for transporting animal pelts purchased from herders

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling coconuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

NWTF is presenting Rosvilla's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for five years. She has been a casual worker and it's from this that she obtained capital to start the cafe.

Jumwa was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, cooking utensils, etc.

Jumwa believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children and also use the money to open a larger cafe or a restaurant in future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 22 years old, and lives in the village of Agarakavan with his parents and three brothers. He studies at the Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture, in the department of adaptive physical culture. He also works at local school as a teacher of physical culture. 

The whole family works hard to sustain their living and cover their basic needs. It is very hard for Gevorg to save money for his education, so he has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan will enable him to complete the education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 51 years old and blessed with three children between 10 and 20 years old. A livestock trader in Narok for the past six years, he earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

Moses has requested his second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His dreams are to grow the business to a large scale and improve his living standards

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Deisy Lorena

texts.es:
Deisy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar más mercadería en variedad, comprándose paletas, bonos, sombrita, sorbetes de diferentes sabores, entre otra variedad de helados que existen y que son del gusto de los clientes.

Ella considera que el efecto que ha tenido como la utilidad de los préstamos es un negocio más estable y con mayor variedad para los clientes, es quien le aprobé lo necesario para su familia que hasta el momento se han mantenido estables económicamente y en salud.
texts.en:
Deisy has decided to apply for a new loan in order to buy a variety of merchandise. She will buy popsicles, cones, paper umbrellas, and various flavors of sorbet, along with a range of the types of ice cream which her clients enjoy.

She believes that the effect of the loans has been to make her business more stable, with a greater variety for her clients. She is able to provide necessities for her family, and so far they have maintained stability both in their financial situation and their health.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, cones, paper umbrellas, and different flavors of sorbet.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for two years. 

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Henry is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Makadara B Group

texts.en:
Makadara B is a group of 14 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Jamila.  The group has 11 women and 3 men. Jamila is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize and sorghum.
