The 2013 Long Rains season will be Jamila’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send her children to school.


Jamila managed to harvest 0.75 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Jamila’s group will receive 7 acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Namulungu Group

texts.en:
Milton is a member of Namulungu Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 5 men. Milton is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Milton is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund so he can generate increased profits, to send his children to school and grow enough food for the family.

Milton says that last year his harvest was good. However, he hopes that he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season to send his children to school, and invest in another business. Milton‘s group members will take input loans of half an acre each, so in total this group will receive input loans for 6 acres of land. 

Please note: Nelly, a member of Samoya Bidii Group, is pictured above. However, her husband has already appeared on Kiva and she shares her OAF membership with him. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, she is pictured as a member of the group, but will not receive funding from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Mufule Group

texts.en:
Patrick is pictured on the right with his hand raised, amongst his Mufule Group members. There are five women and five men in the group, and they are all farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs, such as seed and fertilizer, will be delivered to him on credit to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Patrick first enrolled with One Acre Fund (OAF) during the 2011 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Patrick joined OAF to improve his farming techniques with their methods, and to access the best input prices.

Patrick says that before One Acre Fund he was able to grow about 3/4 bag of maize per half acre, but with his OAF loan during Long Rains 2012, he managed to harvest 9 bags per half acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school, and perhaps invest in a goat. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit, so Patrick‘s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs in total.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kimugui D Group

texts.en:
Hudson is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Kimugui D Group members. The 15 of them, 9 women and 6 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs, such as seed and fertilizer, will be delivered to him on credit to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Hudson joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2008, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Hudson joined One Acre Fund to improve his farming techniques, so he could generate increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Hudson was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 10 bags per half acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to invest in livestock, and perhaps invest in another business. Hudson’s group members will each receive input loans for half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season, so in total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kimugui B Group

texts.en:
Agnes' group, Kimugui B Group, consisting of 12 farmers, is located in Bungoma South District. Agnes is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She will receive input loans for planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.

Agnes joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could rest assured of reliable input delivery and access to the best input prices.

Agnes reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about four bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 11 bags per 1/2 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to improve her family’s living standard and donate some bags to the orphans.

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Agnes’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mechimeru B Group

texts.en:
Julliet, pictured on the right with her hand raised, belongs to the 10-member Mechimeru B Group in Bungoma South District. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Julliet, a new One Acre Fund farmer, is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Julliet described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and invest in another business.

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Julliet’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 35 years old, and blessed with seven children. He is a livestock trader in Narok, Kenya and has been running his business for the past seven years making a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to join a group of other farmers to purchase more livestock for livestock fattening and resale at a gain. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dreams is to improve his living standards

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mabuusi Group

texts.en:
Alice’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Alice is pictured on the right of Mabuusi Group with her hand raised. Alice is pictured amongst the one man and nine women of her group. She will receive loans to enable the planting of ½ an acre with sorghum and maize. Alice first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer as well as to improve her farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 9 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Alice’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos de ocho años y de dos años y medio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para suplir las necesidades del hogar, realiza la venta de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde, luego se dedica a realizar las labores del hogar, ella quiere tener más inventario porque los clientes les demandan ropa.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa para damas y para niños, blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, trajes, con esto podrá tener una mejor disponibilidad y aumentar así la variedad para los clientes.

Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos crezcan sanos y darle el estudio hasta que ellos se superen, en el área del negocio que quiere aumentar con mercadería nueva.
texts.en:
Juana makes a living selling clothes. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband. They have two children, ages two-and-a-half and eight. She sells clothes in order to cover her household necessities. She works from 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. Afterwards, she does housework. She would like to have more inventory because her clients are ordering clothes from her.

She has applied for a loan to buy clothing for women and children, such as shirts, skirts, dresses, pants, and suits. She will then be able to provide greater availability and increased variety for her clients.

One of her dreams is for her children to grow up healthy and to provide them with an education until they excel. In terms of her business, she would like to expand with new merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, pants, and suits.

loans.name: Mechimeru A Group

texts.en:
Meltus is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Mechimeru A Group members. The ten of them, five women and five men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Meltus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Meltus joined One Acre Fund in order to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods and access the best input prices.


Meltus reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 9.5 bags per 1/2 acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Meltus‘ group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: 010327Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Định  operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for making fish sauce.

Định  is 22 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 010327Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ  solidarity group. 
Định  supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  This is Định's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Định  has been involved in this business for four years.  The main hardship that Định  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Định  hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish for making fish sauce.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 39-year-old married man and father of three children.  He has been working as a blacksmith for 13 years. In 2000, he opened his current shop to improve his living and increase his income.  Hasan is applying for his third loan cycle from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary aluminum for his business to make sure that he will respond easily to his customers' needs.

Hasan has a good pay-back history, with a very good reputation. He hopes to keep improving and developing his business to make sure that he can provide his family the best education and living.

loans.use: To buy necessary aluminum for his business
